medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain following routine screening colonoscopy.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was in her usual state of health until waking up from anesthesia post colonoscopy around 5pm today. She woke up with intense, intermittent bilateral subcostal 'tightness.' The pain has gradually decreased since its onset.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Idiopathic pulmonary embolism treated with Coumadin for 9 months, hypothyroidism (no longer on levothyroxine), latent TB status post isoniazid treatment, recurrent urinary tract infections, remote history of chronic intermittent right lower quadrant pain with exploratory laparoscopy showing adhesions of unknown etiology.
medical_history.family_history: No family history of deep vein thrombosis or pulmonary embolism. Sister with breast cancer, father with hyperlipidemia and hypertension, mother with hyperlipidemia.
